name: Alexandra Stan
description:
'''Alexandra Ioana Stan''' (born 10 June 1989) is a Romanian singer. Born in [[Constan»õa]], she made her worldwide breakthrough with the 2010 single "[[Mr. Saxobeat]]", which was written and produced by Marcel Prodan and Andrei Nemirschi. They had previously discovered Stan at a karaoke bar in 2009 and signed her to their label, Maan Records. "Mr. Saxobeat" had followed the singer's debut single, "[[Lollipop (Param Pam Pam)]]" (2009), which brought her moderate fame in Romania. "Mr. Saxobeat" quickly achieved commercial success locally and abroad, reaching number one in several countries and gathering various [[Music recording certification|certification]]s. ''[[Saxobeats]]'', Stan's debut studio album, was released in August 2011 and features the follow-up singles "[[Get Back (ASAP)]]" (2011) and "[[Lemonade (Alexandra Stan song)|Lemonade]]" (2012), which had moderate success in Europe.

An alleged altercation with Prodan in 2013 and [[Alexandra Stan vs. Marcel Prodan|a lawsuit against him]] preceded the release of Stan's second album, ''[[Unlocked (Alexandra Stan album)|Unlocked]]'', which would eventually be issued in August 2014. Two of its singles, "[[Dance (Alexandra Stan song)|Dance]]" (2014) and "[[Cherry Pop]]" (2014), were successful in Japan. Stan's third studio album, ''[[Alesta (album)|Alesta]]'', was released in March 2016 and included a collaboration with [[Inna]] and [[Daddy Yankee]] on "[[We Wanna]]" (2015); the single went on to reach the top 60 in several countries. ''[[Mami (album)|Mami]]'', her fourth record, followed in 2018. Preceding the release of [[Mami (Alexandra Stan album)|its last single]] was Stan's feature on [[Manuel Riva]]'s "[[Miami (Manuel Riva song)|Miami]]" (2018), which peaked within the top ten in Romania and on ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''{{'s}} [[Dance Club Songs]] chart, her fifth studio album ''[[Rainbows (Alexandra Stan album)|Rainbows]]'' was released in 2022, her first album in four years, Stan has received a number of awards and nominations, including the [[European Border Breakers Award]], a [[Japan Gold Disc Award]], an [[MTV Europe Music Awards|MTV Europe Music Award]] and two [[Romanian Music Awards]]. She is also referred to as one of the most successful Romanian artists alongside Inna.
